intro: Leptaloe schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's leptaloe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
